snippet: Scientists who took blood samples from 63 relatively healthy villagers in Peru’s Amazon jungle, where vampire bat bites are common, found seven people who had antibodies to rabies.
abstract: Study in The American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene suggests that rabies may not be 100 percent fatal, citing Peruvian villagers who exhibited antibodies to the disease.
lead_paragraph: Scientists who took blood samples from 63 relatively healthy villagers in Peru’s Amazon jungle, where vampire bat bites are common, found seven people who had antibodies to rabies.

headline.seo: Study Suggests That Rabies May Not Always Be Fatal
headline.main: Peru: Antibodies Seen in Amazon Dwellers Suggest That Rabies May Be Survivable
headline.print_headline: Peru: Antibodies Seen in Amazon Dwellers Suggest That Rabies May Be Survivable

keywords.value: American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene
keywords.name: organizations
